bow: section advice please have section scheduled for weeks from today baby boy is breach and according to my doc pretty well tethered in there so he probably not moving obese and have little bit of belly apron my doc told me that they may consider vertical incision due to this honestly do even care just want healthy baby and healthy mama at the end of the day really just want your advice on things should consider or plan for during recovery have yo daughter get six weeks off and my husband is lucky enough to get six weeks off too ve got the recliner and all the typical pregnancy recovery hoopla just not sure what to expect see if they will give you an abdominal binder it helped me although mine was horizontal so do know if that makes difference nursing pillows or just pillow on your stomach help out also try not to laugh too hard just because it hurt me for few weeks after when did the hardest part for me was the inability to get up from reclined or laying position without help the core strength is just gone for the first week beyond needing help with that it was bad movement is key to healing right the sooner and more you move the better the only other surprise had that think was from me drinking from straw post op guess if you have chest cavity surgery you should drink from straw for at least 24 hours the ma that set me up in my room and got me water was supposed to remove the straw was super thirty so drank lot in the first couple hours from the straw the first time tried to walk to the bathroom assisted made it about feet before could breath what they think happened was was suffocating because my chest cavity had air pockets in it and my stomach did too from drinking with the straw and those air pockets moved up when stood up and significantly restricted my lung capacity holy cow that so scary ll stick to no straw thank you for the advice had section with my son years ago and getting ready for second one in ten weeks not sure how vertical incision will change things but few things that helped me when getting out of bed sit up swings your legs down and slide off the bed make sure you have pillow to hold against your stomach on the ride home potholes suck chances are you will have problems pooping afterwards normal so make sure you have softener at home after showering pat dry don rub the towel over your incision didn bleed that much afterwards not sure if this is true for everyone but pretty sure the doctor sucked lot out make sure you have everything you need on one floor if possible you want to avoid going up and down steps to much those first few days feel like after about two weeks was feeling pretty good and could do most everything except carry lot hope this helps ve heard the binders help ll see if it ll help with vertical too thanks too am obese with the apron had horizontal incision and fully recovered in week with very little pain my doctor used pico wound vac system it was strip of material connected to small box the material wicked drainage had very little while keeping the wound clean and intact the box shut off after week and could have replaced if needed but it wasn necessary it stayed in place 24 for the week it was the first time my ob had used the pico and said it was the best healing process time he had ever seen had an amazing experience with it absolutely worth asking about also the nurse in me needs to remind you to move as soon and often as you can get up and walk around the hospital halls and move around ton at home keep your incision clean with surgical scrub in the shower daily follow doctor instructions and ask your nurses for advice my nurse mom has already been reminding me about the moving and walking haha ll be happy to have the time to resume my nightly walks ll ask about the pico ehat do you recommend to keep that area dry otherwise take regular dosages of laxatives after the surgery until everything going is back to normal consistency have plunger ssriously definitely helps thank you so much am also obese with an apron have had the only advice would add to what has already been said is that if you ever think you may want to try vbac insist on horizontal incision because they can not allow you to vbac with vertical if your bed is high up recommend step stool couldn climb into my bed without stool for almost weeks when nursing if you nurse bobby pillow helped me so my baby wasn hurting my tender stomach don be afraid to take the painkillers tried to stop taking them too soon and it was not fun just my experience with horizontal incision done after this one so no worries about vbac how did you keep the incision site clean and dry my skin has been bizarre this pregnancy so ve been prone to few yeast infections because it high moisture area just pay attention to it through the day if you break sweat dry it up dab don really wipe the area until the wound stays closed some drug stores sell product called interdry use this with my obese patients and it wonderful it is soft thin fabric that lies between the abdominal folds to wick moisture had an emergency section weeks ago feel fine now the first days were painful but not so much that couldn move around at slow pace then the next weeks could walk normal ish loved not being able to do anything lmao was great break although my son was in the nicu so didn have an infant to take care of my husband took care of our year old preferred the section to my vaginal birth might be the exception to the norm don crucify me ladies but both of my section recoveries were breeze sure the incision hurt bit for while but rather that than my vagina hurt for while couldn sit up from lying flat on my back for few weeks but that was really it it wasn the nightmare everyone had warned me about my doctor suggested that my easy recovery may have been due to my willingness to get up and move around it counter intuitive but moving around with no heavy lifting is actually better for you than sitting in the end glad didn have to push baby out of anywhere sign me up for scheduled baby removal please and ll be on my way with my littlest love that what call my 20 month old don worry mama you ll do great the first week or so used gauze after that ok this sounds weird but have these big cotton granny panties right would roll up pair of panties and tuck it in next to my incision my husband is big guy and had vertical incision his surgery wasn as significant as section but the binder really helped him it helped me with my horizontal incision too overweight and have an apron didn have too much trouble just make sure to keep the area dry good luck had an emergency section at 32 weeks and also carry weight in my belly and have quite bit of apron hangover was also told they would consider vertical incision but in the end it was horizontal my advice is basically your standard section advice take the stool softeners as soon as possible and keep taking them get some to take home with you too stay on top of your pain meds was pretty fuzzy for while afterwards so wrote down my pill schedule and set alarms stay ahead of the pain do let it get ahead of you the nurses are going to make you get out of bed and walk way before you ll feel ready and you re going to feel like your insides are going to fall out but it really does help hold pillow against your torso when you sit up sneeze cough or laugh do worry if you have hard time sitting standing up it normal ask for help steal all the mesh underwear from the hospital and maybe get yourself some post partum granny panties could tolerate anything rubbing on or near the incision for long time the recovery was honestly not nearly as bad as expected especially considering was recovering from pre eclampsia and major abdominal surgery felt pretty much normal within couple of weeks but yeah take those stool softeners man did get yeast infection around the incision site and it cleared up with some anti fungal ointment so do your best to keep it dry you can pat dry with towel and then use blow dryer but if it does happen it not big deal already taking stool softeners in anticipation lol ve had two one planned one emergency even though my second one was an emergent section it was so much easier than my first think because knew what to expect hope this thread will help you similarly biggest thing colace even if you think you won need it you will stay on top of your meds at first your body will thank you had pillow kept near me it was helpful to hold that against my tummy when was getting up or to cough and big time in the car using the rock and play was great it was less to pick up or put down my babies helpful during recovery bought way bigger chonies ones that would have waistband that hit well above my incision had nursing basket that put water books snacks nursing pads and lotion would not have to get up holding baby to stay hydrated etc another thing that helped lot would put my palms together with one elbow down on my bed other elbow aimed towards the ceiling and push my palms together to get some momentum to get up without having to use mostly abdominal muscles it can hurt but it was so very worth it to get up as soon as they will let you and get moving good luck and congrats you ve got this used my blow dryer on low and cool to keep under my gut dry and just did it when felt like needed to and after showers am also obese and had section my 1st pregnancy healed up easy breezy used pillow to brace my tummy when sneezing coughing getting up from bed do forget to take the advil and tylenol and drink tons of water planning for 2nd one may this year it might be harder this time with year old running around but we ll have to see how it goes already taking them lol thanks for the response thank you lol pregnancy is weird all good ideas thank you thanks that seems like the biggest advice ve been getting getting up and moving can do that thank you again ll check that out thank you good luck and thank you for the advice thank you for all the advice and the well wishes those diapers they send you home with at the hospital are the most ridiculous and hard to wear things ever go buy some always discreet underwear for after it maybe the best thing did for my comfort had section with my second due to breach and also obese brought up my concerns about my apron and the incision location before the surgery but they were dismissed the day after my post partum appointment my incision opened up it healed after some work and many doctor visits and then opened up three more times after that up until months it opened it was only little bit but it was really upsetting it kept happening to me was suuuuper against section and every time it opened up for me was traumatic felt my concerns were frequently dismissed it was hard it been over year since my section and still regret it hope your experience is the opposite of mine but did want to share my experience with you so you hear all sides of the story if you want to read about my crazy breech experience including versions it in my post history best of luck ok good to know thank you we have low bed luckily thank you good idea definitely want to hear all sides so sorry your experience was traumatic wear granny panties and loose clothes nothing that rubs on the incision remember to take your pain killers the nursing pillow and glider were essential also liked using bassinet so did not have to reach down into crib couldn wear my baby in carrier for about six weeks take good care of yourself you ll need extra support post op and your recovery will be little harder and longer than most vaginal births mine wasn too bad though ve had worse malaise from the flu super high waisted underwear pants that are high and stretchy fabric one of those claw devices to pick things up so you don have to move too much don overdo it had seroma on my incision and had to do wound packing for couple of weeks wouldn wish that on anyone when you get up from laying position roll onto your side and use your arms to push yourself up if you nurse football hold is the easiest hold to keep baby off of your incision had my first section in september second the binder everyone told me when stand up it going to feel like everything going to fall out the binder made everything feel as normal as possible oh air pockets ever heard of em had about 12 hours after my section get sharp pain in my right shoulder it felt like had been shot ve never been shot do know what it feels like the nurse said it common for air to get trapped amp rise to the highest point apparently that my shoulder anyway heat amp pain meds are the only thibg that truly helped they gave me peppermint tea also bring heating pad though just to be safe second this my first was an episiotomy and it got infected it was fucking nightmare could walk for weeks for my section days pp and besides things like coughing and like you said sitting straight up from laying flat it been so much of an easier recovery have tried binding or anything way too lazy for that shit have toddler so do have the luxury of sitting around but trying to take it as easy as possible and its been fine yesterday needed to go to the gp and walked there and back mile each way and it was fine have been taking more then paracetamol because co sleeping at the moment involuntarily it the only place she sleeps so get some sleep no one warned me about the ride home and the road we take is super bumpy it was torture definitely have pillow read through the replies and agree with what here but wanted to add couple of things belly slimming granny panties which my doc called panty girdle were lifesaver for me in the early days if your incision gets chemical burns from the adhesive incision tape they use in the hospital get silver cream for it the halo bassinest was the single greatest comfort item had after baby no getting up to retrieve baby in the middle of the night if you baby wear it can be challenge with cs scar the only carrier that did irritate my incision was the ergo 360 it has much wider belly strap than most other carriers and operates as binder finally someone reddit gave me this advice after my cs abd wish taken it after weeks you ll start to feel pretty normal you ll be getting around the house ok you ll want to go do something something simple like grocery shopping do not do it you are only about 20 healed at this stage you will end up sobbing in the parking lot after using the cart as walked to hobble back from your ill fortuned venture take it easy first baby way regular vaginal birth second was section both required stitches recovery was about equal for both with the second being maybe little easier it was weird when had my horizontal cs they gave me anti gas simethicone tablets religiously think it was to counteract air bubbles like this they also show up in your muscles from when your abdominal cavity is open on the table seconding the bassinest they should be standard issue csection gear you can get them fairly cheap second hand on fb marketplace or craigslist and set it up well before your due date so you re not figuring it out after you come home from the hospital like did this is key it not going to be pleasant but it really the most important part remember any discomfort is temporary too hey have belly apron from being formerly obese and was able to have horizontal incision with both my sections push back on your doctor about that do forget to put pressure on the incision any time you have to cough or sneeze so painful if you do had my little girl just over year ago and was surprised when my doctor told me that they found stool softeners don help go high fiber diet fiber muffins raisin bran tons of liquid metamucil if you think your fiber is too low also had two sections two years apart second one was harder recovery because of my toddler start training yours now that you can pick her up hugs should be gentle and next to you maybe have her lay with you when you re tired get your husband to do all of the heavy lifting toddler included hold nothing heavier than baby if you feel like sneezing cover your belly with pillow and hold it tight going from laying to sitting and sitting to standing is the hardest walk around as soon and as much as you feel able good luck never realized how bad the roads were until was on the way home after my section felt like was going to die did even think about baby wearing use wrap and ring sling how do you think those will work my doc had me air dry my incision any time was laying down or had break when baby did need me was to air dry it move all the clothing and the binder when had to use nystatin powder for my yeast infection it made me air dry it and take rest did the pads thing too had my first section in september accept the meds from the nurses during your recovery afterwards it would take me 15 minutes to get out of the hospital bed because of my sore stomach muscles moving inch by inch finally told her my pain was 10 and they gave me more painkillers it made such difference was able to get out of the bed and use the bathroom on my own do try to be hero accept all the help you re given remember this is considered major surgery good luck use menstrual pads it what my midwife recommended and it worked like charm hold one against your incision take of the protective backing and stick it to your underwear had one pad for postpartum bleeding and one for my incision and it healed great that great idea second the abdominal binder my hospital provided one it was already on when was wheeled into recovery wore that 24 for the first few weeks and it made all the difference it kept my extra belly tight and supported it offered support getting up and down and didn let my incision hang when was walking it was life saver was up walking the same day as delivery my recovery was actually really easy also had breech baby boy and scheduled section so ll add few things my section kept getting postponed due to emergency sections needing the operating rooms coupled with shift change it was hour delay was grateful to not need an emergency section so did mind the delay but we had some bored family members in the waiting room you might check to see if you get weeks off for section my disability insurance covers weeks for vaginal delivery and weeks for section recovered really well from mine but did get my first ever uti from the catheter laughing hurt so much but discovered if made shhh noise while laughing it did hurt definitely hold pillow to your belly if you sneeze no one told me that and pulled muscle your milk may take longer to come in with section so you may need to supplement with formula in the beginning my baby had to have an ultrasound done around weeks to make sure his hips were okay think that pretty standard with breech babies he also failed the hearing tests at the hospital which is more common with sections because they have more fluid in their ears we went back few days later and he passed dude invest in gasx and stool softeners seriously they gave it to me in the hospital and did have any at home and it was the worst time when all else fails take milk of magnesia and stay within few steps of the toilet already taking stool softeners hope that my first poo with my daughter was worse than actual labor lol hahahaha good for you gas post section was the most painful after that def get some granny panties that wo rub on the incision and keep your maternity clothes for awhile also like some flowy skirts or whatever did wear real jeans for months afterwards second the snacks and diaper station or just get adult diapers that what did for all three and trust me it sooo much better have large belly apron had small horizontal incision and healed quickly with no problems best of luck the wrap will probably be ok since you can adjust what hits you where found the ring sling to not provide enough support since my ab muscles were compromised note the baby can flip even at the last minute went to be at 10:45 slept terrible next morning water broke got to hospital with baby head drown and fully engaged by the time the dr got in to see me ended with vag delivery only advice go with the flow and trust your body to know it limits when it time to get out of bed stand straight up slowly it will hurt but the longer you leave it the more it will hurt hope everything goes well yes to the pillow for the pot holes and about 30 minutes before you get discharged ask for pain meds the mesh underwear can be machine washed and dried at home fyi used it for week and then it started irritating my stomach when the nerves are healing it can make you feel like you have sunburn on your abdomen my advice would be to have loose high waisted clothes including underwear with as few seams as possible that has been challenge for me for breastfeeding found the gia pillow by doctor brown and like it the brest friend is too constricting to use during section recovery my first was an easy vaginal birth and my second was an emergency section aside from the nerve pain the recovery has been more difficult
